basics.name: Victor Tolbert
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.headline: A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for.
basics.summary:
My name is Victor Tolbert, a ... My passion for software lies with dreaming up ideas and making them come true with elegant interfaces. I take great care in the experience, architecture, and code quality of the things I build.

Outside of programming, I enjoy photography and traveling. I treasure the feeling when capturing wonderful moments and sharing them with people.

highlights: Vue.js, PHP, Laravel, CodeIgniter

work.summary: Designed, developed, and implemented new features and functionalities for core business application used by parents, sponsors, clients, and internal teams
highlights: Participated in the design and development process from definition to deployment
Worked closely with the design team to ensure consistent UI/UX implementations
Collaborated with the agile development team and engaged in team meetings
Assisted team in managing the overall codebase and infrastructure to minimize downtime
Implemented best practices and helped to create a scalable innovative application
Tech Stack: HTML5, CSS (TailwindCSS, Bulma, Bootstrap), JavaScript, Vue.js, CodeIgniter, Laravel, jQuery, AJAX

work.summary: Developed dynamic and data-driven solutions for consumer facing web and digital platforms for PGA.COM, Ryder Cup, PGA Championship and events platform. Actively participated in project design and direction with new tools and features.
highlights: Hands-on front-end development for custom Drupal based events/CMS platform and back-end

Worked cross-functionally with the development team and functional teams throughout full SDLC from requirements, coding, testing, peer reviews, documentation, deployment and post-launch support and improvement
Troubleshot performance and cross-browser implementation issues for desktop and mobile platforms
Tech Stack: Git, Github, CircleCI, JIRA, Visual Studio Code, PHP, Drupal, JavaScript (Vue.js, React, jQuery), CSS (Sass), Gulp

work.company: Videa, A Cox Media Group Company
work.summary: Designed and developed a web-based interactive product demo using Node.js and Vue.js
highlights: Conceptualized and prototyped new features for core product utilizing Vue.js, Vue Router and Vuex

Recognized company-wide for individual effort and contribution of a product demo (Vue.js, Nuxt.js) used as a stand-in for the real product at the National Association of Broadcasters (NAB) trade conference
Created Open Source TVB XML Proposal Viewer utilizing PHP/MySQL and the Laravel Framework
Served as the sole liaison between visual design, on-site and off-shore engineering teams
Tech Stack: Microsoft .Net MVC, TFS, Git, Visual Studio, Azure, AWS, PHP, Wordpress, Laravel, JavaScript (AngularJS, Vue.js, React), Kendo UI
Provided user interface development for a project to integrate the AT&T Locker, Messages and Contacts cloud applications into one unified consumer application suite
Collaborator and contributor to custom in-house Sass/CSS bootstrapping framework to consistently implement AT&T’s CDLS 2.0 branded styles and flexible components
Develop middleware services using Java/Groovy based Camel framework
Tech Stack: Java, JSP, Apache CAML, JavaScript (AngularJS), CSS/Sass
Team lead for key revenue generating products and initiatives
Hand-coded and documented modular website components using object-oriented native JavaScript and jQuery
Converted a Flash-based widget for iPhone/iPad compatibility using HTML5, CSS3 animations and JavaScript
Mentored and on-boarded new team members
Received a “Star” award for outstanding teamwork
JavaScript (jQuery), CSS3 (Sass/Compass), HTML5, XSL/XSLT, Documentum, WordPress, Endeca WebStudio, Git, Github Enterprise
Rapidly prototyped the vehicle compare tool user interface for usability testing
Presented and demo’d prototype to an audience including the CEO, CFO and CIO
Received a company-wide monthly “Top Techie” award multiple times
HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Prototype/Scriptaculous), JAVA (JSP, JSTL, JSF), CVS, Subversion, Rhythmyx
